title: Xp Installation Cant Find C: Drive

forumNotes.author: nocturnal87
forumNotes.content:
I have hp netbook xp installation was messed up so I used ultimatebootcd4win and put it on a usb pen drive and formatted the hard drive \& partitioned it, I used multiboot10 to make a usb xp installation disk followed instructions 10 times same thing happens every time I get to screen to select drive to install on and it only shows U: (Which is the usb pen drive) It Wont Show My C: Drive -- HOW CAN I FIX THIS!!!!!!!   

**Edited by nocturnal87, 14 February 2011 - 06:31 AM.**

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
> I have hp netbook xp installation was messed up so I used ultimatebootcd4win and put it on a usb pen drive and formatted the hard drive \& partitioned it, I used multiboot10 to make a usb xp installation disk followed instructions 10 times same thing happens every time I get to screen to select drive to install on and it only shows U: (Which is the usb pen drive) It Wont Show My C: Drive -- HOW CAN I FIX THIS!!!!!!!  
Your Install sources misses the appropriate Mass Storage driver.  
You need to integrate to it the BTS mass storage driver pack [http://driverpacks.net/](http://driverpacks.net/ "External link") BEFORE creating the USB install stick.  
In other words:  
Original XP Source-\>nlite(optional)-\>BTS driverspack-\>USB_MultiBoot.cmd or WinSetupFromUSB with GUI-\>USB Install stick  

![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)  
Wonko
